knowledges_ids.K0001: Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies.

knowledges_ids.K0002: Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk).

knowledges_ids.K0003: Knowledge of laws, regulations, policies, and ethics as they relate to cybersecurity and privacy.

knowledges_ids.K0004: Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles.

knowledges_ids.K0005: Knowledge of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.

knowledges_ids.K0006: Knowledge of specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses.

knowledges_ids.K0108: Knowledge of concepts, terminology, and operations of a wide range of communications media (computer and telephone networks, satellite, fiber, wireless).

knowledges_ids.K0109: Knowledge of physical computer components and architectures, including the functions of various components and peripherals (e.g., CPUs, Network Interface Cards, data storage).

knowledges_ids.K0350: Knowledge of accepted organization planning systems.

knowledges_ids.K0362: Knowledge of attack methods and techniques (DDoS, brute force, spoofing, etc.).

knowledges_ids.K0377: Knowledge of classification and control markings standards, policies and procedures.

knowledges_ids.K0379: Knowledge of client organizations, including information needs, objectives, structure, capabilities, etc.

knowledges_ids.K0392: Knowledge of common computer/network infections (virus, Trojan, etc.) and methods of infection (ports, attachments, etc.).

knowledges_ids.K0395: Knowledge of computer networking fundamentals (i.e., basic computer components of a network, types of networks, etc.).

knowledges_ids.K0400: Knowledge of crisis action planning for cyber operations.

knowledges_ids.K0403: Knowledge of cryptologic capabilities, limitations, and contributions to cyber operations.

knowledges_ids.K0408: Knowledge of cyber actions (i.e. cyber defense, information gathering, environment preparation, cyber-attack) principles, capabilities, limitations, and effects.

knowledges_ids.K0411: Knowledge of cyber laws and legal considerations and their effect on cyber planning.

knowledges_ids.K0414: Knowledge of cyber operations support or enabling processes.

knowledges_ids.K0417: Knowledge of data communications terminology (e.g., networking protocols, Ethernet, IP, encryption, optical devices, removable media).

knowledges_ids.K0422: Knowledge of deconfliction processes and procedures.

knowledges_ids.K0432: Knowledge of existing, emerging, and long-range issues related to cyber operations strategy, policy, and organization.

knowledges_ids.K0435: Knowledge of fundamental cyber concepts, principles, limitations, and effects.

knowledges_ids.K0436: Knowledge of fundamental cyber operations concepts, terminology/lexicon (i.e., environment preparation, cyber-attack, cyber defense), principles, capabilities, limitations, and effects.

knowledges_ids.K0444: Knowledge of how Internet applications work (SMTP email, web-based email, chat clients, VOIP).

knowledges_ids.K0455: Knowledge of information security concepts, facilitating technologies and methods.

knowledges_ids.K0465: Knowledge of internal and external partner cyber operations capabilities and tools.

knowledges_ids.K0501: Knowledge of organization cyber operations programs, strategies, and resources.

knowledges_ids.K0504: Knowledge of organization issues, objectives, and operations in cyber as well as regulations and policy directives governing cyber operations.

knowledges_ids.K0506: Knowledge of organization objectives, leadership priorities, and decision-making risks.

knowledges_ids.K0507: Knowledge of organization or partner exploitation of digital networks.

knowledges_ids.K0508: Knowledge of organization policies and planning concepts for partnering with internal and/or external organizations.

knowledges_ids.K0511: Knowledge of organizational hierarchy and cyber decision-making processes.

knowledges_ids.K0514: Knowledge of organizational structures and associated intelligence capabilities.

knowledges_ids.K0538: Knowledge of target and threat organization structures, critical capabilities, and critical vulnerabilities

knowledges_ids.K0585: Knowledge of the organizational structure as it pertains to full spectrum cyber operations, including the functions, responsibilities, and interrelationships among distinct internal elements.

knowledges_ids.K0598: Knowledge of the structure and intent of organization specific plans, guidance and authorizations.

knowledges_ids.K0599: Knowledge of the structure, architecture, and design of modern digital and telephony networks.

skills_ids.S0185: Skill in applying analytical methods typically employed to support planning and to justify recommended strategies and courses of action.

skills_ids.S0186: Skill in applying crisis planning procedures.

skills_ids.S0213: Skill in documenting and communicating complex technical and programmatic information.

skills_ids.S0218: Skill in evaluating information for reliability, validity, and relevance.

skills_ids.S0249: Skill in preparing and presenting briefings.

skills_ids.S0250: Skill in preparing plans and related correspondence.

skills_ids.S0296: Skill in utilizing feedback to improve processes, products, and services.

skills_ids.S0297: Skill in utilizing virtual collaborative workspaces and/or tools (e.g., IWS, VTCs, chat rooms, SharePoint).

skills_ids.S0326: Skill to distinguish between notional and actual resources and their applicability to the plan under development.

skills_ids.S0360: Skill to analyze and assess internal and external partner cyber operations capabilities and tools.

abilities_ids.A0013: Ability to communicate complex information, concepts, or ideas in a confident and well-organized manner through verbal, written, and/or visual means.

abilities_ids.A0066: Ability to accurately and completely source all data used in intelligence, assessment and/or planning products.

abilities_ids.A0067: Ability to adjust to and operate in a diverse, unpredictable, challenging, and fast-paced work environment.

abilities_ids.A0068: Ability to apply approved planning development and staffing processes.

abilities_ids.A0070: Ability to apply critical reading/thinking skills.

abilities_ids.A0074: Ability to collaborate effectively with others.

abilities_ids.A0077: Ability to coordinate cyber operations with other organization functions or support activities.

abilities_ids.A0081: Ability to develop or recommend planning solutions to problems and situations for which no precedent exists.

abilities_ids.A0082: Ability to effectively collaborate via virtual teams.

abilities_ids.A0085: Ability to exercise judgment when policies are not well-defined.

abilities_ids.A0089: Ability to function in a collaborative environment, seeking continuous consultation with other analysts and experts--both internal and external to the organization--to leverage analytical and technical expertise.

abilities_ids.A0090: Ability to identify external partners with common cyber operations interests.

abilities_ids.A0094: Ability to interpret and apply laws, regulations, policies, and guidance relevant to organization cyber objectives.

abilities_ids.A0096: Ability to interpret and understand complex and rapidly evolving concepts.

abilities_ids.A0098: Ability to participate as a member of planning teams, coordination groups, and task forces as necessary.

abilities_ids.A0105: Ability to tailor technical and planning information to a customer's level of understanding.

tasks_ids.T0571: Apply expertise in policy and processes to facilitate the development, negotiation, and internal staffing of plans and/or memorandums of agreement.

tasks_ids.T0581: Assist and advise interagency partners in identifying and developing best practices for facilitating operational support to achievement of organization objectives.

tasks_ids.T0582: Provide expertise to course of action development.

tasks_ids.T0601: Collaborate with other team members or partner organizations to develop a diverse program of information materials (e.g., web pages, briefings, print materials).

tasks_ids.T0627: Contribute to crisis action planning for cyber operations.

tasks_ids.T0629: Contribute to the development, staffing, and coordination of cyber operations policies, performance standards, plans and approval packages with appropriate internal and/or external decision makers.

tasks_ids.T0635: Coordinate with intelligence and cyber defense partners to obtain relevant essential information.

tasks_ids.T0665: Develop or participate in the development of standards for providing, requesting, and/or obtaining support from external partners to synchronize cyber operations.

tasks_ids.T0666: Develop or shape international cyber engagement strategies, policies, and activities to meet organization objectives.

tasks_ids.T0669: Develop strategy and processes for partner planning, operations, and capability development.

tasks_ids.T0670: Develop, implement, and recommend changes to appropriate planning procedures and policies.

tasks_ids.T0671: Develop, maintain, and assess cyber cooperation security agreements with external partners.

tasks_ids.T0699: Facilitate interactions between internal and external partner decision makers to synchronize and integrate courses of action in support of objectives.

tasks_ids.T0700: Facilitate the sharing of 'best practices' and 'lessons learned' throughout the cyber operations community.

tasks_ids.T0712: Identify and manage security cooperation priorities with external partners.

tasks_ids.T0729: Inform external partners of the potential effects of new or revised policy and guidance on cyber operations partnering activities.

tasks_ids.T0732: Integrate cyber planning/targeting efforts with other organizations.

tasks_ids.T0739: Maintain relationships with internal and external partners involved in cyber planning or related areas.

tasks_ids.T0747: Monitor and evaluate integrated cyber operations to identify opportunities to meet organization objectives.

tasks_ids.T0759: Contribute to the review and refinement of policy, to include assessments of the consequences of endorsing or not endorsing such policy.

tasks_ids.T0760: Provide subject matter expertise to planning teams, coordination groups, and task forces as necessary.

tasks_ids.T0763: Conduct long-range, strategic planning efforts with internal and external partners in cyber activities.

tasks_ids.T0764: Provide subject matter expertise to planning efforts with internal and external cyber operations partners.

tasks_ids.T0766: Propose policy which governs interactions with external coordination groups.

tasks_ids.T0772: Prepare for and provide subject matter expertise to exercises.

tasks_ids.T0784: Provide cyber focused guidance and advice on intelligence support plan inputs.

tasks_ids.T0787: Provide input for the development and refinement of the cyber operations objectives, priorities, strategies, plans, and programs.

tasks_ids.T0795: Provide planning support between internal and external partners.

tasks_ids.T0817: Serve as a conduit of information from partner teams by identifying subject matter experts who can assist in the investigation of complex or unusual situations.

tasks_ids.T0818: Serve as a liaison with external partners.

tasks_ids.T0823: Submit or respond to requests for deconfliction of cyber operations.

tasks_ids.T0825: Synchronize cyber international engagement activities and associated resource requirements as appropriate.

tasks_ids.T0826: Synchronize cyber portions of security cooperation plans.

tasks_ids.T0836: Document lessons learned that convey the results of events and/or exercises.
